p: Each infected homogenate was prepared by grinding 88 ± 3 mg of the green parts (i.e., leaves and stems) of potato plants ( Solanum tuberosum cv. ‘Pentland Squire’) grown in vitro cultures and infected with PVY NTN. This was then mixed with 20 mL nutrient solution that consisted of tap water with added minerals (Johnson et al. 1994). We divided each of the infected homogenates into two samples of 10 mL: one that served as a positive control and was not treated further, and the other that was treated with hydrogen peroxide (H 2O 2) (control treatment, various concentrations) or CAP (various times).
